Database
C API

A database contains tables, indexes, and sequences defined by the database schema. More...

Macros

#define DB_OPEN_EXISTING   0x000000u
 Open the database object, which must already exist.
 
#define DB_OPEN_OR_CREATE   0x100000u
 Open the database object, creating it if necessary.
 
#define DB_CREATE_OR_OVERWRITE   0x200000u
 Create an empty database object, replacing an existing database if necessary.
 
#define DB_CREATE_NEW   0x300000u
 Create an empty database object, which must not already exist.
 
#define DB_OPEN_CREATE_MASK   0x300000u
 Bitmask for open/create flags.

File Modes

Flags for db_file_storage_config_t::file_mode.

#define DB_READ_ONLY   0x0001u
 Open database for reading only. More...
 
#define DB_NOLOGGING   0x0002u
 Disable logging. More...
 
#define DB_NOLOCKING   0x0004u
 Disable locking. More...
 
#define DB_UTF8_NAME   0x0008u
 File name is in UTF-8 encoding, default is ANSI encoding. More...
 
#define DB_ATOMIC_WRITE   0x0010u
 Write database pages atomically, even if the storage media does not support atomic writes. More...
 
#define DB_CONN_LOCK   0x0020u
 Wait for connection lock instead of try lock.
 
#define DB_RISK_INCONSISTENCY   0x0040u
 Open database even if a required log file is missing. More...
 
#define DB_SNAPSHOT_STORAGE   0x0080u
 Use new snapshot file format. More...
 
#define DB_VERIFY_CHECKSUMS   0x0100u
 Verify checksums when data is read from the database file. More...

#define DB_FILE_RAMFS   0x50000u
 RAM virtual file interface. More...
 

Detailed Description

A database contains tables, indexes, and sequences defined by the database schema.

See also
C API, Cursor, Row, Data Types, Schema

◆ db_encrypt_t

typedef int(DB_CALLBACK * db_encrypt_t) (void *udata, uint32_t offset, void *data, size_t size)

Encryption call-back function.

Encrypt the data stored in the buffer data of size size. Encryption should be performed in-place and cannot alter the size of the data buffer.

Parameters
udataUser-defined data stored in db_crypt_t::udata.
offsetThe page number where the data is stored. offset can be used to seed encryption algorythm.
dataData to encrypt in-place.
sizeSize of the data to encrypt.
Returns
DB_NOERROR. Other error codes are reserved for future use.

◆ db_decrypt_t

typedef int(DB_CALLBACK * db_decrypt_t) (void *udata, uint32_t offset, void *data, size_t size)

Decryption call-back function.

Decrypt the data stored in the buffer data of size size. Decryption should be performed in-place and cannot alter the size of the data buffer.

Parameters
udataUser-defined data stored in db_crypt_t::udata.
offsetThe page number where the data is stored. offset can be used to seed encryption algorythm.
dataData to decrypt in-place.
sizeSize of the data to decrypt.
Returns
DB_NOERROR. Other error codes are reserved for future use.

Function Documentation

◆ db_create_file_storage()

db_t db_create_file_storage ( const db_fname_t *  file_uri,
const db_file_storage_config_t *  config 
)

Create a database stored in a file.

The database is immediately opened after creation.

Parameters
file_uriDatabase file name or remote URL, in one of the following forms:
  • "[path/]example.db"
  • "idb+tcp://server[:port]/[path/]example.db"
  • "idb+shm://[share-name]/[path/]example.db"
configStorage creation and access configuration.
Returns
  • A handle to the opened database.
  • NULL on failure.

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

  • DB_EINVAL Configuration parameter is null.
  • DB_EACCESS File exists and is read-only.
  • DB_EOSERROR The file is otherwise unreadable.
  • DB_ESOCKETCONNECTION A connection to the server cannot be established (IPC client only.)
  • DB_ESOCKETHOSTNAME The given host name cannot be resolved (IPC client only.)
  • DB_ESTORAGE Storage cannot be created due to invalid configuration.
Warning
If the file already exists, it will be overwritten.
See also
db_open_file_storage, db_shutdown

◆ db_open_file_storage()

db_t db_open_file_storage ( const db_fname_t *  file_uri,
const db_file_storage_config_t *  config 
)

Open an existing database storage file.

Parameters
file_uriAn existing database file name or remote URL, in one of the following forms:
  • "[path/]example.db"
  • "idb+tcp://server[:port]/[path/]example.db"
  • "idb+shm://[share-name]/[path/]example.db"
configStorage access configuration.
Returns
  • A handle to the opened database.
  • NULL on failure.

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

  • DB_EINVAL Could be caused by: file name is null or invalid storage mode.
  • DB_ESTORAGE Storage data is invalid. Invalid page size could be the source of this error.
  • DB_ENOENT The file does not exist.
  • DB_EACCESS The file cannot be read, or is read-only.
  • DB_EOSERROR The file is otherwise unreadable.
  • DB_ESOCKETCONNECTION A connection to the server cannot be established (IPC client only.)
  • DB_ESOCKETHOSTNAME The given host name cannot be resolved (IPC client only.)
  • DB_ESTORAGE Storage cannot be opened; the file does not appear to be a valid database. If the file is encrypted, check the encryption configuration.
See also
db_create_file_storage, db_shutdown

◆ db_set_access_password()

db_result_t db_set_access_password ( db_t  hdb,
const db_ansi_t *  password,
db_flags_t  flags 
)

Set a storage password.

Parameters
hdbA database connection.
passwordPassword string.
flagsReserved for future use. Set to 0.

The password is saved in the storage. Subsequent attempts to open the same storage will fail unless the same password is supplied through authorization credentials.

◆ db_create_memory_storage()

db_t db_create_memory_storage ( const db_fname_t *  storage_name,
const db_memory_storage_config_t *  config 
)

Create a database stored in memory.

The database is immediately opened after creation.

Parameters
storage_nameDatabase name.
configStorage creation and access configuration.
Returns
  • A handle to the opened database.
  • NULL on failure.

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

  • DB_EINVAL Configuration parameter is null or misconfigured.
  • DB_EACCESS Memory storage exists and is already open by another connection.
  • DB_ESOCKETCONNECTION A connection to the server cannot be established (IPC client only.)
  • DB_ESOCKETHOSTNAME The given host name cannot be resolved (IPC client only.)
Warning
If the memory storage already exists, it will be overwritten.

The memory storage is destroyed when db_done is called in the process that hosts the database. The memory storage is hosted in the current process unless the storage_name is a remote URI.

The default table type for a memory storage is DB_TABLETYPE_MEMORY. No other table types can be created in a memory storage.

See also
db_open_memory_storage, db_shutdown

◆ db_open_memory_storage()

db_t db_open_memory_storage ( const db_fname_t *  storage_name,
const db_memory_storage_config_t *  config 
)

Open an existing database stored in memory.

Parameters
storage_nameName of the existing database.
configStorage access configuration.
Returns
  • A handle to the opened database.
  • NULL on failure.

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

  • DB_EINVAL Could be caused by: storage name is null or invalid storage mode.
  • DB_ESTORAGE Storage data is invalid. Invalid page size could be the source of this error.
  • DB_ENOENT The memory storage does not exist.
  • DB_ESOCKETCONNECTION A connection to the server cannot be established (IPC client only.)
  • DB_ESOCKETHOSTNAME The given host name cannot be resolved (IPC client only.)

The memory storage is destroyed when db_done is called in the process that hosts the database. The memory storage is hosted in the current process unless the storage_name is a remote URI.

The default table type for a memory storage is DB_TABLETYPE_MEMORY. No other table types can be created in a memory storage.

See also
db_create_memory_storage, db_shutdown

◆ db_shutdown()

db_result_t db_shutdown ( db_t  hdb,
int  r = 0,
void *  v = NULL 
)

Close a database file storage.

Parameters
hdbDatabase handle.
rReserved for future use, set to zero.
vReserved for future use, set to NULL.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.
  • DB_FAIL on failure.

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

  • DB_EINVAL Invalid database handle or parameter.
  • DB_ELOCKED A transaction is still active in another thread. The database will not be closed in this case.
  • DB_ESOCKETSEND Could not send shutdown command to server. The connection to the server has been closed. (IPC client only)
See also
db_create_file_storage, db_open_file_storage,
get_db_error, clear_db_error, Error Handling

◆ db_set_timeout()

db_result_t db_set_timeout ( db_t  hdb,
db_wtime_t  msec 
)

Set the length of time that an operation will wait for a lock to become available.

This ensures that every database operation will eventually return. Most operations will fail if a lock times out.

Parameters
hdbConnection for which to set timeout.
msecTime in milliseconds. Use a duration of INT_MAX to disable timeouts.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.
  • DB_FAIL on failure.

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

  • DB_ENOTIMPL if the library does not support timeouts.

The single-user package does not support db_set_timeout or db_get_timeout. In the single-user library, this function will return DB_FAIL with the error code DB_ENOTIMPL.

See also
get_db_error, clear_db_error, Error Handling

◆ db_get_timeout()

db_wtime_t db_get_timeout ( db_t  hdb)

Obtain current lock timeout setting.

Parameters
hdbConnection for which to get timeout.
Returns
  • Time in milliseconds.
  • DB_WTIME_FAIL on failure.

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

  • DB_ENOTIMPL if the library does not support timeouts.

The single-user package does not support db_set_timeout or db_get_timeout. In the single-user library, this function will return DB_WTIME_FAIL with the error code DB_ENOTIMPL.

See also
get_db_error, clear_db_error, Error Handling

◆ db_backup()

db_result_t db_backup ( db_t  h,
const db_fname_t *  dest_file_name,
uint32_t  file_mode,
db_flags_t  flags 
)

Copy a database to a backup file.

Parameters
hSource database.
dest_file_nameDestination file name.
file_modeOptions for creating destination file. Any bitwise combination of:
  • DB_UTF8_NAME: File name encoded in UTF8.
flagsReserved for future use. Set to 0.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.
  • DB_FAIL on failure.

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

  • DB_EINVAL Caused by: invalid database handle, null file name, or invalid file mode.
  • DB_EACCESS File exists and is read-only.
  • DB_EOSERROR The file is otherwise unreadable.

Create a backup database file and an associated log file. Both files are required to restore the backup. Open the database file created by db_backup normally to apply the log file.

db_backup returns only when the backup is complete. Other connections to the same database are not interrupted, and can read and write changes safely.

When connected to an ITTIA DB server, the backup file location is relative to the server process.

Only disk tables are copied. A memory table must be copied to a disk table prior to the backup to include its contents in the backup file.

The backup file created with this function is never encrypted, even if the original is. Use db_backup_ex to create an encrypted backup.

See also
db_open_file_storage

◆ db_backup_ex()

db_result_t db_backup_ex ( db_t  hdb,
const db_fname_t *  backup_file_name,
const db_backup_t *  backup_info 
)

Copy a database to a backup file.

Parameters
hdbSource database.
backup_file_nameDestination file name.
backup_infoSettings for creation of the backup copy. Use NULL for defaults.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.
  • DB_FAIL on failure.

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

  • DB_EINVAL Caused by: invalid database handle, null file name, or invalid file mode.
  • DB_EACCESS File exists and is read-only.
  • DB_EOSERROR The file is otherwise unreadable.
  • DB_ESOCKETCONNECTION A connection to the server cannot be established (IPC client only.)
  • DB_ESOCKETHOSTNAME The given host name cannot be resolved (IPC client only.)

Create a backup database file and an associated log file. Both files are required to restore the backup. Open the database file created by db_backup normally to apply the log file.

db_backup returns only when the backup is complete. Other connections to the same database are not interrupted, and can read and write changes safely.

When connected to an ITTIA DB server, the backup file location location is relative to the server process.

Only disk tables are copied. A memory table must be copied to a disk table prior to the backup to include its contents in the backup file.

A cipher may be specified in backup_info to encrypt the backup files. The original files are automatically decrypted, if necessary. In this way, a backup can be created with a different encryption key than the original.

See also
db_open_file_storage

◆ db_get_prio()

int db_get_prio ( db_t  hdb)

Get database connection priority.

Parameters
hdbDatabase handle.
Returns
  • Current priority for the database connection.
  • DB_LEN_FAIL on failure.
See also
db_set_prio,
get_db_error, clear_db_error, Error Handling

◆ db_set_prio()

int db_set_prio ( db_t  hdb,
int  prio 
)

Set database connection priority.

Parameters
hdbDatabase handle.
prioNew priority, between DB_PRIO_MIN and DB_PRIO_MAX. The default value is DB_PRIO_NORMAL.
Returns
  • Previous priority for the database connection.
  • DB_LEN_FAIL on failure.

Connections with a lower priority value will defer to connections with a higher priority value when locking resources.

See also
db_get_prio,
get_db_error, clear_db_error, Error Handling

◆ db_open_iot_file_storage()

dbstatus_t db_open_iot_file_storage ( const char *  file_name,
const char *  alias,
uint32_t  flags,
int32_t  page_size,
void *  storage_cache_segment,
size_t  storage_cache_size 
)

db_open_iot_storage opens or creates a database storage.

Parameters
file_nameName of file or storage media
alias(optional) Alias name for connection and close storage
flagsSpecify behavior when database does or does not already exists
page_sizeSize of each database page
storage_cache_segmentDatabase page cache memory segment base address
storage_cache_sizeDatabase page cache memory segment size
Returns
DB_NOERROR on success, negative number on failure.

If the same database file is already open, db_open_iot_storage does nothing and returns DB_EEXIST.

◆ db_close_storage()

dbstatus_t db_close_storage ( const char *  name)

db_close_storage closes all connections to a database storage and releases all connection handles.

Parameters
name(optional) Name or alias of storage
Returns
DB_NOERROR on success, negative number on failure

When name is NULL, all databases instances are closed.

◆ db_connect()

dbstatus_t db_connect ( db_t *  handle,
const char *  name,
const char *  user_name,
const char *  password,
void *  context 
)

db_connect opens a connection to an open database storage from a single thread.

Parameters
[out]handleDestination for database connection handle
nameName or alias of storage
user_name(optional) name of an authorized user
password(optional) password token
context(optional) User connection context
Returns
DB_NOERROR on success, negative number on failure

Each thread must call this function access the specified database.

If the database was opened with an alias, name must be an alias.

◆ db_flush_file()

dbstatus_t db_flush_file ( db_t  handle,
db_flags_t  flags 
)

db_flush_file writes cached database changes to disk

Parameters
handleHandle to an ITTIA DB database connection
flagsFlush mode and completion mode
Returns
DB_NOERROR on success, negative number on failure

Choose one flush mode flag:

  • DB_FLUSH_JOURNAL (default)
  • DB_FLUSH_STORAGE

Choose one completion mode flag:

  • DB_GROUP_COMPLETION (default)
  • DB_FORCED_COMPLETION

The default flags are sufficient to persist data.

DB_NOERROR on success, negative number on failure

◆ db_set_storage_variable()

dbstatus_t db_set_storage_variable ( db_t  db,
db_fieldno_t  variable,
db_largeint_t  value 
)

Set the value of a storage variable in a database.

Parameters
dbHandle to an ITTIA DB database connection
variableNumber that identifies the variable
valueValue to write
Returns
DB_NOERROR when successful, negative number on failure

Up to 16 variables may be stored in each database, numbered 0-15.

A transaction is started if no transaction is active. The value is only saved permanently when the transaction is committed.
